issue.title: cmake or nmake not producing package config

content.raw: Are the dependencies all built with Debug as well? The build type needs to match for all of them.
content.html: Are the dependencies all built with Debug as well? The build type needs to match for all of them.

issue.title: cmake or nmake not producing package config

content.raw:
Yep the ign-math and sdformat were both built by starting with "..\configure Debug".

I'll try a non-debug build and see if that can find the sdformat package.
content.html:

issue.title: cmake or nmake not producing package config

content.raw:
..\configure (implicit Release build) also failed.

After a few hours of clumsily feeling my way through the cmake documentation I was able to fix the problem at least as far as getting the cmake command to run without errors, I'm yet to test the Visual Studio build. 

The problem was this block of cmake script from .\gazebo\sdformat\build\install\Debug\lib\cmake\sdformat\SDFormatConfigVersion.cmake

```
#!cmake

# if the installed or the using project don't have CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P set, ignore it:
if("${CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P}" STREQUAL "" OR "8" STREQUAL "")
   return()
endif()

# check that the installed version has the same 32/64bit-ness as the one which is currently searching:
if(NOT CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P STREQUAL "8")
  math(EXPR installedBits "8 * 8")
  set(PACKAGE_VERSION "${PACKAGE_VERSION} (${installedBits}bit)")
  set(PACKAGE_VERSION_UNSUITABLE TRUE)
endif()
```
On my Windows 10 x64 machine CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P == 4 so the check for sdformat always bombed out.

My fix was to put a return() statement above that block. I know I built sdformat as x64 which is also what I'm building gazebo as.
content.html:
..\configure (implicit Release build) also failed.

After a few hours of clumsily feeling my way through the cmake documentation I was able to fix the problem at least as far as getting the cmake command to run without errors, I'm yet to test the Visual Studio build.

The problem was this block of cmake script from .\gazebo\sdformat\build\install\Debug\lib\cmake\sdformat\SDFormatConfigVersion.cmake

# if the installed or the using project don't have CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P set, ignore it:
if("${CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P}" STREQUAL "" OR "8" STREQUAL "")
   return()
endif()

# check that the installed version has the same 32/64bit-ness as the one which is currently searching:
if(NOT CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P STREQUAL "8")
  math(EXPR installedBits "8 * 8")
  set(PACKAGE_VERSION "${PACKAGE_VERSION} (${installedBits}bit)")
  set(PACKAGE_VERSION_UNSUITABLE TRUE)
endif()

On my Windows 10 x64 machine CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P == 4 so the check for sdformat always bombed out.

My fix was to put a return() statement above that block. I know I built sdformat as x64 which is also what I'm building gazebo as.

issue.title: cmake or nmake not producing package config

content.raw:
If `CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P ==4`, then cmake thinks you have 32bit machine. Are you positive that everything has been compile as x64, and you are using a 64-bit pc?

Have you followed [these instructions](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_on_windows&cat=install) exactly?
content.html:
If CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P ==4, then cmake thinks you have 32bit machine. Are you positive that everything has been compile as x64, and you are using a 64-bit pc?

Have you followed these instructions exactly?

issue.title: cmake or nmake not producing package config

content.raw:
My silly mistake. Was using:

cmake --debug-output -Wno-dev -G "Visual Studio 12 2013"

instead of:

cmake --debug-output -Wno-dev -G "Visual Studio 12 2013 Win64"
content.html:
My silly mistake. Was using:

cmake --debug-output -Wno-dev -G "Visual Studio 12 2013"

instead of:

cmake --debug-output -Wno-dev -G "Visual Studio 12 2013 Win64"
